translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在於寒林，受給孤長者請，預知舍衛國中有諸外道，各各苦行又復聰明，雖勤修習不得解脫，根緣已熟受化是時。
translation: The Bhagavān was in the cold forest when he was invited by the elder Gokul to foresee that there were heretics in Śrāvastī who were both ascetic and intelligent, who had cultivated diligently but hadn't attained liberation, and whose faculties had matured and who were then transformed.

source_sentence: 世尊又觀誰可往彼？
translation: The Bhagavān then observed, "Who can go there?

source_sentence: 唯舍利弗乃有宿因，此若先行必有大利。
translation: Only Śāriputra had a prior reason for going ahead, and there would be great benefit if he went ahead.

source_sentence: 於是世尊喚舍利弗，令先往彼舍衛大城，助給孤獨建立精舍。
translation: The Bhagavān then summoned Śāriputra and told him to go ahead to the great city of Śrāvastī and help him build a monastery for the orphan.

source_sentence: 尊者受命往舍衛城，詣長者所，事皆參議。
translation: His Holiness was ordered to go to Śrāvastī and visit the elder's office, where he discussed everything.

source_sentence: 給孤長者承外道意來白尊者：「彼欲論義，於理如何？」
translation: The elder Gṛdhrakūṭa came to the Bhagavān with the advice of the heretics and said, "They want to discuss the meaning, but what's the principle?"

source_sentence: 又云：「此國之人素未知佛，於法勝劣宜其宣揚。」
translation: It also said, "The people of this country have never known the Buddha, so it's appropriate to proclaim the superiority and inferiority of the teaching."

source_sentence: 舍利弗曰：「善哉，善哉！
translation: Śāriputra said, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 斯言誠諦。」
translation: This is called the truth."

source_sentence: 尊者於是入定觀察，諸外道輩及舍衛國人，根緣成熟有幾時分？
translation: The Venerable then entered into meditation and observed, "How long has it been since the faculties and conditions of the group of non-Buddhists and the people of Śrāvastī have matured?

source_sentence: 見彼人眾唯餘七日。
translation: He saw that crowd of people for only seven more days.

source_sentence: 尊者出定告長者曰：「請語外道，過七日已可來論義。」
translation: The Venerable left his meditation and told the elder, "Please tell the non-Buddhists that they can come to discuss the meaning after seven days have passed."

source_sentence: 長者具告。
translation: The elder told him exactly that.

source_sentence: 外道思惟：「立七日限斯有二事：一者知己非勝，設計私逃；二者或求本朋來共商攉。」
translation: The non-Buddhist thought, "There are two things that can happen when you set a limit of seven days: one, you know you're not superior and you're planning to escape privately; and two, you might ask your friends to come and discuss the matter with you."

source_sentence: 如是思已，「我今云何不求朋侶？」
translation: After thinking about it this way, he said, "Why don't I ask a friend now?"

source_sentence: 由是諸處親自訪尋，乃得一人，名赤眼婆羅門，而告之曰：「彼瞿曇沙門有大弟子索我論義，汝婆羅門應宜相助。
translation: Going from place to place, he personally searched and found a man named the red-eyed brāhmaṇa who told him, "That Gautama monk has a great disciple who asks me for an explanation, so it's appropriate for you, Brāhmaṇa, to help him.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若自得勝利養猶存，彼或勝時我等何往？」
translation: If our own victories and benefits remain, where will we go when they are victorious?"

source_sentence: 彼即問言：「何時論義？」
translation: He then asked, "When will the meaning of the treatise be discussed?"

source_sentence: 報曰：「後當七日。」
translation: He replied, "It will be seven days from now."

source_sentence: 「至時相報，必來助汝。」
translation: "I'll give you my reward when I get there, and I'll come to your aid."

source_sentence: 然婆羅門憂其墮負心甚煩惱，發信諸處求告朋黨。
translation: Still, the Brāhmaṇa was so troubled by his fallacy that he sent letters to various places asking for friends.

source_sentence: 七日滿已，給孤長者就寬靜處權立論場，即為舍利弗尊者排師子座，為彼外道對排高座。
translation: When the seven days were up, the elder Gṛdhrakūṭa authorised a quiet place to set up a discussion forum, where he arranged a lion's seat for Venerable Śāriputra and a high seat for the heretic.

source_sentence: 列座既畢遠近咸集，若公、若私迨及少長，有百千人集彼論處，亦有別國外道、婆羅門亦來會所。
translation: After he had finished arranging the seats, people from near and far gathered there, both public and private, as well as young elders, and a hundred thousand people gathered there for the discourse, while some foreigners and priests from other countries also came to the meeting place.

source_sentence: 給孤長者手執香爐焚以妙香，與眷屬等同為擁從，迎舍利弗上師子座；尊者坐定，一切瞻仰，覩其威容悉皆讚歎。
translation: Holding a censer in his hand and burning a wonderful incense, the elder Vaiśravaṇa and his retinue embraced and welcomed Śāriputra to his lion's seat; as he sat there, they all looked up and admired his dignified appearance, and they all praised him.

source_sentence: 時彼外道與眾相隨，亦昇高座。
translation: That heretic and the crowd that followed him then also ascended to the high seat.

source_sentence: 安坐已定，尊者告言：「汝欲何作？」
translation: After they had settled into their seats, the Venerable addressed them, "What do you want to do?"

source_sentence: 外道言：「我現神通，我既現已汝當亦現。」
translation: The non-Buddhists said, "Now, I have the power, and after I show it, you will also show it."

source_sentence: 尊者報言：「我所作者，天上人間所不能作，云何汝言能同我作？」
translation: The Venerable replied, "I've created something that no one in heaven or on earth can create, so why do you say you can create it the same way I can?"

source_sentence: 尊者又言：「赤眼婆羅門！
translation: The Venerable also said, "Red-eyed Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝所作者我悉能破。」
translation: I can refute all your authors."

source_sentence: 赤眼婆羅門化作花樹，如實芳葩豔冶動眾；尊者神力出微少風，其花根苗吹散異處。
translation: The red-eyed Brāhmaṇa transformed into a flowering tree with truly fragrant flowers that are resplendent and attractive to many people, and the Venerable's miraculous powers produced a slight breeze that scattered the roots and seedlings of those flowers to different places.

source_sentence: 又化一池水滿澄湛，蓮花遍發人讚異常；尊者化出大象膚體端正，入池蹂踐須臾狼藉。
translation: He also transforms a pond that fills to overflowing with clear water, and the lotus blossoms everywhere emit praise for their unusual appearance; the venerable produces a large elephant with correct skin and body that enters the pond and tramples it in a moment's time.

source_sentence: 外道又化一龍而有七首，張鱗努目奮惡拏空；尊者化金翅王，從空飛下坐於龍首，龍自降伏。
translation: The non-Buddhist also transformed a dragon with seven heads that spread its scales, opened its eyes, and roused itself to violence, and apprehended the sky; the Venerable created the Gold Winged King, who flew down from the sky and sat on the dragon's head, and the dragon subdued itself.

source_sentence: 時彼外道乃於最後化羅剎身立在眾前，醜惡異常人見恐怖；尊者持呪神力縛之，羅剎苦惱翻生瞋怒，外道驚怖身毛皆立，恐惡自傷發言求救，告尊者言：「我今歸依，願賜救護。」
translation: When the heretic finally transformed into a rāṣṇa, he stood in front of the crowd, ugly and unnatural, and was terrified when people saw him.

source_sentence: 尊者解呪，羅剎怒息。
translation: The Venerable explained the spell, and the Rāṣṭrapāla's anger subsided.

source_sentence: 時赤眼婆羅門得脫羅剎怖畏之難，又復覺知本所修習非是正行，告舍利弗曰：「願於尊者正法出家而為沙門，尊者大慈哀愍聽許。」
translation: The red-eyed Brāhmaṇa then was freed from the fearful embarrassment of the Rāṣasas and realized that what he had been cultivating was not correct practice. He told Śāriputra, "I wish to leave home and become a monk in accordance with the true teaching of His Holiness, and I beg your great kindness and compassion to grant permission."

source_sentence: 舍利弗即與攝受度為沙門；後修梵行斷盡煩惱，雖居三界而離貪毒，其心平等由如虛空，觀金如土而無別異，於後修習得三明六通，證阿羅漢果，乃得帝釋諸天而來供養。
translation: Śāriputra then took him in and made him an ascetic; he then cultivated the religious practice, ended the afflictions, became free of the poison of desire even though he lived in the three realms, became equal in mind like space, observed gold like earth without distinction, and subsequently cultivated the three insights and six powers and realized the fruit of the arhat, which then allowed the Indra celestials to come and offer their support.

source_sentence: 時大眾驚怪目注心凝，異口同聲讚舍利弗：「是論義師無人能敵，猶如牛王處於眾群。」
translation: The crowd was astonished, their eyes and minds transfixed, and they all spoke with one voice in praise of Śāriputra, "This teacher of doctrine is unrivaled, like a king of cattle in a herd."

source_sentence: 一切瞻仰無有厭足。
translation: They all looked up to him without ever getting tired of him.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗知眾心意及其種性，即為廣說苦、集、滅、道四聖諦法。
translation: Knowing the minds of the people and their various natures, Śāriputra then explained in detail the four noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path.

source_sentence: 是會大眾有發三歸心者，有發聲聞菩提心者，有發辟支菩提心者，有發無上菩提心者；亦有出家證得須陀洹果，有證斯陀含果，有證阿那含果，有證阿羅漢果。
translation: Some of the assembled people had aroused the attitude of the three refuges, some had aroused the attitude of śrāvaka bodhisattva, some had aroused the attitude of pratyekabuddha bodhisattva, and some had aroused the attitude of unsurpassed bodhisattva; some had left home and realized the fruit of stream entry, some realized the fruit of once-returning, some realized the fruit of non-returning, and some realized the fruit of arhatship.

source_sentence: 論義畢已會眾皆散，諸外道中有執性者，以其論義不勝辱於屈伏，潛共計議欲謀不軌：「可投長者請作工人，或得便時殺彼尊者。」
translation: After the conclusion of the discourse, the assembly dispersed, and some laypeople who had come to believe in the nature of the teachings were insulted and subjugated by their arguments, and they conspired together to plan misconduct, saying, "Perhaps we could go to the elder and ask him to be a worker, or perhaps we could kill that venerable at an appropriate time."

source_sentence: 設計已定，白長者言：「汝已斷我一切利養，今者無所歸趣，却願相愍收作工人，或察卑心且住鄉士，或不從允各去他邦。」
translation: Once their designs were settled, they said to the elder, "You've cut off all my benefits and now I have no place to go, so I hope you'll kindly accept him as a worker, or maybe you'll examine my humble intentions and stay in my village, or maybe you won't accept him and go to another country."

source_sentence: 哀告再三，傍不忍聽。
translation: He repeatedly begged him, but the other side couldn't bear to listen.

source_sentence: 長者於是具述彼意白舍利弗：「仁可思察於理如何？」
translation: The elder then explained his intentions to Śāriputra, "Sir, could you consider this, and examine the principle?"

source_sentence: 舍利弗即入三昧，觀彼根緣證道非遙，遽云：「何患？」
translation: Śāriputra then entered samādhi, observed their faculties and conditions, realized that the path was not remote, and rushed off saying, "What's the trouble?"

source_sentence: 長者即退，錄其姓名，遣作工夫例與其直。
translation: The elder then withdrew, recorded his name, and sent him out to do his work in a straightforward manner.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗化出一人，於工夫中便為首領。
translation: Śāriputra then produced a man who was the leader of the effort.

source_sentence: 尊者於後觀知根熟，來彼役所，就一樹下安詳而坐。
translation: Observing his faculties as ripe, the Venerable then came to his servant's office and sat down quietly under a tree.

source_sentence: 時彼外道初為得便，各各心喜欲來親近；而彼首領執杖驅策不得前進。
translation: When those outsiders first gained an advantage, each of them was pleased and wanted to come close, but the leader took his staff and drove them away, preventing them from advancing.

source_sentence: 役既疲苦乃發聲言：「聖大尊者！
translation: When the servant became weary and distressed, he spoke up and said, "Venerable Ārya!

source_sentence: 救我！
translation: Help me!

source_sentence: 救我！」
translation: Help me!"

source_sentence: 舍利弗曰：「汝等疲勞，可自歇息。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "You may rest yourselves because you're so tired."

source_sentence: 諸外道：「此大尊者我發殺心欲謀其命，今亦知我而令止息，實自慚懼無以再言。」
translation: The non-Buddhists said, "This great honored one, I intended to kill him, and now I've been told to stop, so I really feel ashamed and fearful that I can't say anything more."

source_sentence: 時舍利弗察其追悔，又知根性成熟時分，乃呼近前便與說法，即為演說苦、集、滅、道四聖諦法。
translation: When Śāriputra observed his remorse and knew the time had come when his faculties were ripe, he summoned him close and then explained the teaching, which was to expound the four noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path.

source_sentence: 外道聞已，所有身見如二十山峰，以金剛智悉破無餘，應時獲得須陀洹果。
translation: After the heretic heard this, he saw his body like 20 mountain peaks, which he had destroyed without remainder with his adamantine wisdom, and he then attained the fruit of stream entry.

source_sentence: 復言：「尊者！
translation: Again, he said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 欲於正法出家為僧。」
translation: He wants to leave home and become a monk in the right path."

source_sentence: 舍利弗攝受度為沙門，漸漸進修精持梵行，見於輪迴趣其究竟，斷盡煩惱證阿羅漢果，其心平等猶如虛空，觀彼金土兩物不異，棄捨世利得大清涼，當受帝釋諸天一切供養。
translation: Śāriputra was taken in and raised up as a monk, gradually continued to pursue the religious practice, saw the cycle of transmigration leading to its ultimate destination, ended the afflictions, realized the fruit of the arhat, became equal in mind like space, observed that gold and dirt were not two different things, abandoned worldly gains and great coolness, and would accept all the offerings of the Indra celestials.

source_sentence: 爾時舍利弗化外道已，即與給孤長者共持一繩，各執其頭，量度精舍都大界至。
translation: After he had converted the non-Buddhists, Śāriputra and Gṛdhrakūṭa held a rope together, each holding his head, and measured the great perimeter of the monastery.

source_sentence: 界至已定，給孤長者所感果報，於兜率天現金宮殿；給孤長者不達聖意，謂舍利弗曰：「今此精舍不獨只為諸阿羅漢，我為如來、應、正等覺。」
translation: After the delimitation was complete, the reward for Gṛdhrakūṭa was cash in the palace of Tuṣita Heaven. Gṛdhrakūṭa didn't understand the noble teaching and said to Śāriputra, "Now, this abode isn't just for arhats; I'm the Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Enlightened One."

source_sentence: 舍利弗曰：「我本所作正為如來，及阿羅漢。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "What I was doing was precisely for the Tathāgata and the arhats."

source_sentence: 又謂長者曰：「汝此封地，天報已現。」
translation: He also told the elder, "You've sealed off this land, and the reward of heaven has appeared."

source_sentence: 即借天眼，令其自見。
translation: He then lent him the divine eye and made him see for himself.

source_sentence: 長者見已驚喜無量，於是復發上上品心。
translation: After he saw it, the elder was astonished and delighted beyond measure, and he then again aroused the attitude of superior qualities.

source_sentence: 舍利弗又自持繩一頭，令長者還執一頭，於中分擘十六殿堂、六十小堂，佛僧住處各各已定，彼金宮殿變寶莊嚴。
translation: Śāriputra then took one end of the rope himself and made the elder take another end, dividing it into 16 halls and 60 small halls, where the Buddha and monks were each staying, and transforming the golden palace into a jeweled adornment.

source_sentence: 尊者借通，復令觀見。
translation: The venerable lent his supernormal power and again made him look at them.

source_sentence: 長者歡喜乃自歎曰：「我此所作，當感如是福德之利。」
translation: Rejoicing, the elder praised himself, "This is the kind of merit that will reward me for what I've done."

source_sentence: 長者自見當來福報重重有異，復更於事轉倍精勤，擘殿堂已，及備其中一切受用。
translation: Seeing for himself the rewards of his future merits, the man then redoubled his efforts, broke down the palace, and prepared all the things in it for use.

source_sentence: 精舍事畢，復白尊者：「世尊行住，其量云何？」
translation: After finishing his work in the monastery, he then said to the venerable, "Bhagavān, what's the measure of your practice and abode?"

source_sentence: 尊者報言：「用輪王儀。」
translation: The venerable replied, "Use the wheel-turning king's rituals."

source_sentence: 於是長者，自舍衛國至王舍城，每十俱嚕舍各造一宮，以備如來止宿之地，及置庫藏牧貯一切所受用物；復令主者而恒守護，以白檀水日日灑淨，伺候如來令其香潔。
translation: The elder then built a palace for each of the ten garuḍas from Śrāvastī to Rājagṛha to provide a place for the Tathāgata to stay and a storehouse for storing all the things he receives for use, and he had the person in charge of it guard it constantly, sprinkling it daily with water made from white sandalwood, and waiting on the Tathāgata to make it smell nice and clean.

source_sentence: 處處如是，皆使嚴備。
translation: Every place was thus made completely ready.

source_sentence: 辦事畢已，即發一人詣王舍城請佛及眾，謂所去人：「汝到於彼，代我詞曰：『給孤長者稽首雙足白于世尊，少病少惱，起居輕利，安樂行否？
translation: When his work was done, he sent one of his men to the city of Rājagṛha to invite the Buddha and his entourage, saying to the man who had gone, "When you arrive there, tell him on my behalf, 'Does that orphaned elder bow his head and feet and tell the Bhagavān that he's less ill and less troubled, gets up and lives lightly, and practices in comfort?'

source_sentence: 所立精舍今已嚴備，願佛及眾愍念降臨，當盡此生奉上僧伽梨、飲食、湯藥并臥具，種種受用不使乏少，佛正遍知，願鑒虔切。』」
translation: Now that the monastery that was built has been fully prepared, may the Buddha and all the people have mercy on us and come down, and we will spend our whole lives presenting saṃghârī, food, medicine, and bedding, so that the various necessities won't be lacking, and may the Buddha know it exactly and reverently.'"

source_sentence: 去人領意到於佛所，以長者言具白世尊，復倍虔心而伸告請。
translation: The departed man took his advice and went to the Buddha, told the Bhagavān in full in the words of the elders, and then repeatedly and reverently extended his invitation.

source_sentence: 傳意已畢，五體著地禮佛雙足，旋繞三匝顒住佛前。
translation: When he had finished conveying his intentions, he bowed his five bodies to the ground at the Buddha's feet, circled him three times, and stayed in front of him.

source_sentence: 佛利樂故默然許之。
translation: Because the Buddha was pleased, he quietly approved.

source_sentence: 去人知佛決定赴請，速還舍衛見於長者，而白言云：「世尊默然，必來降赴。」
translation: Knowing that the Buddha was determined to comply with the invitation, the departed man quickly returned to Śrāvastī and met the elder, saying, "The Bhagavān is silent; he will surely come and give his assent."

source_sentence: 長者歡喜，於是陳列傘蓋、幢幡、名香、妙花處處迎接。
translation: Rejoicing, the elder then arranged umbrellas, banners, banners, famous incense, and marvelous flowers to greet them everywhere.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸大眾：「阿羅漢等可共往赴給孤之請。」
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the crowd, "Arhats, we can all go to the invitation to give aid to Gokul."

source_sentence: 佛領大眾前後圍繞，離王舍城詣舍衛國，瞻顧左右告羅漢等：「我此眷屬是調伏、是離欲、是善解脫、是阿羅漢、是佛眷屬，譬如牛王處於眾群，亦如象王眾象圍繞，師子王師子圍繞，鵝王鵝眾圍繞，金翅王金翅圍繞；又如眾學隨師，眾病求醫，眾兵輔將，眾商依主；又如轉輪聖王千子圍繞，持國天王樂神圍繞，增長天王鳩盤茶鬼圍繞，廣目天王龍眾圍繞，多聞天王夜叉圍繞，日天千光圍繞，月天星宿圍繞，帝釋天眾圍繞，梵王梵眾圍繞；乃至復如悉帝彌魚處於海中，亦如海神攝聚眾水；如來之身，三十二相、八十種好具足圓滿，光明莊嚴，如千日光照耀一切，行步巍巍猶如寶山，具足大悲、十力、四無畏等一切諸法。」
translation: 佛領大眾前後圍繞，離王舍城詣舍衛國，瞻顧左右告羅漢等：「我此眷屬是調伏、是離欲、是善解脫、是阿羅漢、是佛眷屬，譬如牛王處於眾群，亦如象王眾象圍繞，師子王師子圍繞，鵝王鵝眾圍繞，金翅王金翅圍繞；又如眾學隨師，眾病求醫，眾兵輔將，眾商依主；又如轉輪聖王千子圍繞，持國天王樂神圍繞，增長天王鳩盤茶鬼圍繞，廣目天王龍眾圍繞，多聞天王夜叉圍繞，日天千光圍繞，月天星宿圍繞，帝釋天眾圍繞，梵王梵眾圍繞；乃至復如悉帝彌魚處於海中，亦如海神攝聚眾水；如來之身，三十二相、八十種好具足圓滿，光明莊嚴，如千日光照耀一切，行步巍巍猶如寶山，具足大悲、十力、四無畏等一切諸法。」

source_sentence: 爾時世尊成就如是殊勝威德、解脫眷屬，次第行化至舍衛國。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had accomplished such remarkable virtue and liberated his followers, and he traveled to the country of Śrāvastī in order to teach them.

source_sentence: 時給孤長者與其眷屬，將諸侍人，各各執持幢幡、寶蓋及妙香花，出舍衛城遠迎世尊及大聖眾。
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa and his retinue then gathered their attendants, each carrying a banner, banners, a jeweled lid, and a wonderful scented flower, and left Śrāvastī to welcome the Bhagavān and the great sages.

source_sentence: 復有國中長者、士庶、若男若女，百千人眾亦來迎接；又有無數諸天，在虛空中隨喜讚歎。
translation: A hundred thousand people, including elders, commoners, men, and women of the country, also came to greet them, and countless gods rejoiced and praised them in the sky.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊入城門時，即以右足蹈其門閫，於是大地六種震動，放大光明照耀世間，天鼓自鳴雨眾天花，所謂優鉢羅花、鉢捺摩花、俱母那花、奔拏里迦花、乃至曼陀羅劫樹等花，又降沈檀及多摩羅等眾妙香粖，又復舍中種種音樂不鼓自鳴；盲者得視，聾者聞聲，啞者能言，不完具者皆得完具，迷醉者得醒，食毒者自安，相憎者和解，禁縛者解脫，懷妊者得生，乃至貧者得豐資財。
translation: When the Bhagavān entered the city, he placed his right foot between the gates and inspected them, and the earth shook in six ways, shining brightly and illuminating the world; the gods' drums beat themselves to rain down flowers, such as the blue lotus, the padma flower, the kumuda flower, the puṇḍarīka flower, and the mandāraka tree, and other flowers; they also sent down various kinds of wonderful fragrances such as sambac and tamāla; the music in the monastery beat itself without a drum; the blind got their eyesight, the deaf heard sounds, the dumb were able to speak, those who weren't completely equipped got completely equipped, the drunk got awake, those who ate poison were made comfortable, those who hated each other were reconciled, those who were bound were freed, those who were pregnant were born, and the poor got an abundance of possessions.

source_sentence: 世尊入城之時，乃有如是百千吉祥瑞應利益之事。
translation: When the Bhagavān entered the city, these were the hundreds of thousands of auspicious events that were supposed to benefit him.

source_sentence: 至長者宅，佛與大眾次第而坐。
translation: When he arrived at the house of the elder, the Buddha and the crowd sat down one by one.

source_sentence: 長者所有若親若踈一切眷屬，皆來焚香散花禮拜供養。
translation: All of the elder's relatives, whether close or distant, came to burn incense, scatter flowers, venerate, and make offerings.

source_sentence: 種種畢已，給孤長者執爐焚香，引佛世尊入於精舍。
translation: After they had finished their various offerings, the orphaned elder took a stove, burned incense, and led the Bhagavān into the monastery.

source_sentence: 佛昇寶座，諸阿羅漢亦皆就坐。
translation: The Buddha ascended to his jeweled throne, and the arhats all took their seats.

source_sentence: 時給孤長者即取金瓶，欲灌世尊網鞔之手，瀉水不出。
translation: The elder orphan then took a gold flask and tried to pour water into the Bhagavān's netted, calabash-bearing hands, but the water didn't pour out.

source_sentence: 長者思惟：「我莫昔有不善業耶？
translation: The elder thought, "Did I do something unwholesome in the past?

source_sentence: 乃於今日致有斯事。」
translation: This is what's happening today."

source_sentence: 佛告長者：「無不善業，但為此地汝於過去正等正覺已曾捨施修為精舍，勿作住心今為能施，若離此者水必流出。」
translation: The Buddha told the elder, "There's no unwholesome activity, but for this place you've cultivated a fine abode of giving after having given alms in the past to the perfectly enlightened, so don't hold on to your mind that you can give now; if you leave this, the water will surely flow out."

source_sentence: 長者對曰：「如佛所說。」
translation: The elder replied, "As the Buddha has said."

source_sentence: 作是語已，瓶水出聲具五功德。
translation: After he said this, the water from the vial produced a sound that was endowed with five virtues.

source_sentence: 灌佛手已，願佛隨意。
translation: After he poured it into the Buddha's hand, he vowed that the Buddha would do as he pleased.

source_sentence: 又復白言：「請為立名。」
translation: He also said, "Please name it."

source_sentence: 時祇陀童子亦在佛會，作是念曰：「佛若知者先說我名。」
translation: The youth Jeta was also present at the Buddha's meeting and had this thought, "If the Buddha knows this, he'll first say my name."

source_sentence: 佛應所思，立精舍名號祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: In response to that thought, the Buddha named the monastery Jeta Grove Anāthapiṇḍada Park.

source_sentence: 祇陀童子得聞是已，乃於如來轉倍發心歡喜愛樂，更以四寶裝嚴其門。
translation: After he heard this, the youth Jeta rejoiced and loved the Tathāgata with renewed vigor, and he adorned his entrance with four treasures.

source_sentence: 祇樹給孤精舍之名，因此所立。
translation: That's how the Jetavana monastery got its name.

source_sentence: 爾時舍衛國主勝軍大王，聞佛遊化來入其國，受給孤長者請住於精舍，歡喜踊躍，詣於佛所，以種種語讚歎世尊，禮拜旋繞却坐一面，作是言曰：「我聞瞿曇沙門知自心相證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，瞿曇沙門依法喜論說，彼所有心亦得名邪亦得名正，亦可作善亦可作惡，而此心相無有去來，不可知不可說，是甚深法。
translation: It was then that the great king Prasenajit, lord of Śrāvastī, heard that the Buddha had traveled to his country, accepted the elder Gṛdhrakūṭa's invitation to stay at the monastery, rejoiced, and rushed to the Buddha's place, praised the Bhagavān with various words, paid homage, circled around, withdrew to sit to one side, and said, "I've heard that the Gautama monk knows the characteristics of his own mind and has realized unsurpassed, correct, good, and evil, and that the characteristics of that mind have no past or future, are unknowable and inexplicable, and are a profound teaching.

source_sentence: 云何可知？」
translation: How can it be known?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「王所說者乃是真實，而彼心者亦得名邪亦得名正，亦可作善亦可作惡，而此心相無有去來，不可知不可說，是甚深法。
translation: The Buddha said, "The king's explanation is true, and that mind can be called wrong and right, which can do good and evil, and the characteristics of that mind have no coming or going, are unknowable and inexplicable, which is a profound teaching.

source_sentence: 我知是心，證得無上正等正覺。」
translation: Knowing this mind, I've realized unsurpassed correct enlightenment."

source_sentence: 王言：「瞿曇沙門！
translation: The king said, "Gautama the monk!

source_sentence: 云何乃作如是之說？
translation: How is it possible to say this?

source_sentence: 彼有耆舊迦葉、摩蹉梨娛舍離子、散惹曳尾囉致子、阿[口*爾]多計舍劍末羅、迦俱那迦旦也(二合)、野曩禰誐囉陀倪也(二合)帝子，彼等亦知心相，尚不證無上正等正覺；云何沙門少年始新出家，言證無上正等正覺？」
translation: Are there Jīva Kāśyapa, Mañjuśrī, Śāriputra, Ajñāta-Kauśāmbī, Kārttika, and Nāgārada, Tissa, who also know the characteristics of mind but have yet to realize unsurpassed correct enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 勿作是說，世有四事不得輕慢。
translation: Don't say this, for there are four things in the world that you shouldn't despise.

source_sentence: 何者為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者王子不得輕慢；二者龍小不得輕慢；三者火小不得輕慢；四者僧小不得輕慢。
translation: One, a prince mustn't despise; two, a dragon mustn't despise being small; three, a fire mustn't despise being small; and four, a saṃgha mustn't despise being small.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 而彼王子生剎利種，具足王相有大福德，於後成長必紹尊位，愚人無智謂小可慢，彼處寶位獲罪無悔。
translation: That prince is born from the bhadra family, is fully endowed with the characteristics of a king, and has great virtue that will surely lead to a position of honor later in life. A foolish man without intelligence thinks it's small and arrogant, and he'll be placed in a position of treasure that earns him a sin without regret.

source_sentence: 又復龍者，稟性毒惡變現不恒，或隱大身作小形質，愚人不識輕慢觸惱，須臾恚怒翻被傷害。
translation: Also, that dragon has a venomous nature that manifests itself inconsistently, or it hides its large body and takes on a small form, which foolish people who don't know don't take lightly and are arrogant enough to touch, and then they're angered and hurt in a moment.

source_sentence: 又復火者能燒一切，或見微少不得輕慢，人若輕者後必蔓延，聚落山林皆悉燒壞。
translation: Also, that fire burns everything, and when it sees something small, it mustn't be taken lightly; if someone takes it lightly, it will spread and burn up all the villages and mountains.

source_sentence: 又復僧者清淨自守，雖是年少不得輕慢，見道證果非止老幼，亦復不擇久近貴賤，世人無慧不辯凡聖，遇阿羅漢輙起毀辱，所獲罪報如斷多羅樹頭不得再生，雖勤懺謝亦不除滅。」
translation: Furthermore, although a monk is pure and self-controlled, he mustn't despise young people, doesn't stop at old and young at heart when he sees the path and realizes its fruit, and doesn't discriminate between long and near nobility and lowliness; people lacking wisdom don't discern between worldlings and sages, and they are quick to insult arhats when they meet them.

source_sentence: 時勝軍王得聞如來說是四法，深心信受追悔言過，即以頭面禮佛雙足，懺謝旋繞，歡喜而退。
translation: Upon hearing the Tathāgata teach these four things, King Prasenajit acknowledged them with deep faith and repentance, saluted the Buddha's feet with his head and face, thanked him, circled him, and rejoiced as he withdrew.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊於舍衛國化利畢已，思欲往彼迦毘羅城。
translation: After the Bhagavān had finished teaching and benefiting the country of Śrāvastī, he contemplated going to that city of Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時勝軍王承佛化導心堅歸向，遂發使奉書上淨飯王：「汝皇太子悉達多，證得無上甘露法味，於世出世間咸蒙濟度。」
translation: Having been guided by the Buddha's transformation, King Prasenajit sent a messenger up to King Jōtoku to write, "Your royal prince, Siddhârtha, has realized the taste of the unsurpassed nectar of the Dharma, and he has been saved by everyone in the world and beyond."

source_sentence: 淨飯王聞已遽即思慮：「雖喜我子已成正覺，今若遣使定化出家。」
translation: After hearing this, King Jingfan quickly considered, "Although I'm glad my son has achieved perfect enlightenment, if I send an envoy now, I'm sure he'll be converted to leave home."

source_sentence: 以手榰頤再三詳審。
translation: He put his hand over his face and examined it again and again.

source_sentence: 時有大臣名烏那曳曩，見王如是而發問言：「大王！
translation: Then, a minister named Udayinavatī saw the king like this and asked, "Great king!

source_sentence: 云何榰頤不樂？」
translation: What is prophecy and nonjoy?"

source_sentence: 王即報言：「我非不樂，有所思事。
translation: The king then reported, "It's not that I'm unhappy; I have something to think about.

source_sentence: 勝軍大王有書報我，悉達太子已成正覺，在舍衛國給孤精舍，有千弟子皆阿羅漢。
translation: The great king Prasenajit has written to me that Prince Siddhârtha has become perfectly enlightened and is staying at Vikramāditya's monastery in Śrāvastī with a thousand disciples who are arhats.

source_sentence: 我昔為彼苦行去時，發人尋求至今不迴，今若遣使定是不復，云何可知有如此事？
translation: When I left on his behalf to engage in ascetic practices, I sent someone to seek him out, but he hasn't returned yet. If I send an envoy now, I'm sure it won't happen again.

source_sentence: 彼悉達多聰明智慧咸悉過人，凡所言說誰不諦信，我以此事而思慮之。」
translation: That Siddhârtha's intelligence and wisdom are all superior to those of other people, and there's no one who doesn't truly believe what he says. I've taken this matter into consideration."

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩即白王言：「臣今請行，願勿為慮。」
translation: Udayinna then said to the king, "Now, I'd like to ask you to do it, but please don't think about it."

source_sentence: 王曰：「唯汝一人我常在念，若能爾者誠為大善。」
translation: The king said, "You're the only one I'm always thinking about; if you can do that, it would really be very good."

source_sentence: 王即親手而修書曰：「汝一切義成是我親子，既厭煩惱棄國出家，為求無上正等正覺。
translation: The king then personally revised the document with his own hand, saying, "You are my dear son, who abandoned his country and left home because he was tired of affliction in order to pursue unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 已聞成道教化眾生，思念之心日時相續。
translation: I've heard that you've accomplished the path of teaching sentient beings, and my thoughts continue to be with you day after day.

source_sentence: 今他人得樂唯我苦惱，譬如大樹因地而生，既有根苗終望果實。
translation: Now, while others may attain happiness, I'm the only one who suffers, like a great tree that grows from the ground and has its roots and seedlings but eventually expects fruit.

source_sentence: 汝心已遂，宜憶往願昔者所言：『若不證無上菩提寂靜之道，誓不再入迦毘羅城。』
translation: Now that your mind has been completed, remember what those of yore said in a past vow, 'If I don't realize the tranquil path of unsurpassed enlightenment, I'll never again enter the city of Kapila.'

source_sentence: 大行已成，宜應愍我及眷屬等。」
translation: Now that you've accomplished this great practice, you should take pity on me and my retinue."

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩從王受書，速至舍衛行詣精舍。
translation: Udayinī received the writing from the king and quickly went to Śrāvastī to visit the monastery.

source_sentence: 既至佛所，白言：「世尊！
translation: When he arrived at the Buddha's place, he said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 父王淨飯致書於佛。」
translation: My father gave a clean meal to the Buddha in writing."

source_sentence: 言訖捧上。
translation: After he finished speaking, he handed it to him.

source_sentence: 佛乃親受開封披讀，須臾默然。
translation: The Buddha then personally accepted it, unsealed it, and read it, and was silent for a moment.

source_sentence: 時烏那曳曩又白佛言：「今請世尊，去迦毘羅城。」
translation: Udayinī said to the Buddha, "Now, Bhagavān, I'd like you to go to Kapilavastu."

source_sentence: 佛言：「我去。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I'll go."

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩即五體投地方伸禮敬，禮已再禮以至於極，又白佛言：「世尊若去，斯亦無言，或不去者，必堅請去。」
translation: Udayinī then threw his five bodies into the ground, saluted, and venerated him again, bowing to the utmost, and said to the Buddha, "If the Bhagavān leaves, I won't say anything; if he doesn't, I'll insist on leaving."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為烏那曳曩說伽陀曰：「佛眼淨能見，　　無所著之者；　見無邊不往，　　汝何能將往？
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke to Ānāthapiṇḍada, saying, "The Buddha's eye is pure and able to see, and there's nothing to be attached to; how can you go there if you see nothing limitless and don't go there?

source_sentence: 佛眼見無邊，　　不著貪愛者；　精進力無往，　　汝何能將往？
translation: "The Buddha's vision is limitless; he doesn't cling to craving; his effort has no going, so how can you go?

source_sentence: 若人心不亂，　　彼亦無降伏；　無邊智無步，　　汝何能堅往？
translation: If people's minds aren't disturbed, they aren't subdued; limitless knowledge has no step, so how can you go firmly?

source_sentence: 若人有得無降伏，　　彼亦無有不降伏；　如佛進力步無邊，　　汝以何步能堅往？」
translation: If there are people who attain and aren't subdued, there's nothing they don't subdue; as the Buddha's advancing power takes limitless steps, what steps can you take that will firmly lead you there?"

source_sentence: 時烏那曳曩白世尊言：「我欲持此所說偈頌聞淨飯王。」
translation: Ānāthapiṇḍada then said to the Bhagavān, "I want to hold this verse that I've spoken and hear it from Śubhavyūha."

source_sentence: 佛告烏那曳曩：「我意不爾。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānāthapiṇḍada, "I don't think so."

source_sentence: 又曰：「若不爾者，其意云何？」
translation: He also said, "If that's not the case, what do you think?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲汝出家。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I want you to leave home."

source_sentence: 又曰：「我本來時與王有約，若是見佛定須迴還。」
translation: He also said, "I originally made a promise to the king that if I saw the Buddha this way, I would definitely return."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝勿違約，要去可去，但剃髮染衣斯亦無礙。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Don't renege on that promise; you can go if you want to, but shaving your hair and dyeing your clothes won't prevent you from doing so."

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩言：「世尊為菩薩時尚依父母、師長之所教授，我今何敢不依教也？
translation: Udayinī said, "When the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he still relied on what his parents and teachers taught him, so how dare I not rely on what was taught to me now?

source_sentence: 今求出家，願佛濟度。」
translation: Now, I seek to leave home, and I hope the Buddha will save me."

source_sentence: 佛即應時度為沙門。
translation: The Buddha then granted him ordination as a monk.

source_sentence: 佛便告言：「烏那曳曩！
translation: The Buddha then told them, "Upaniṣad!

source_sentence: 汝今可往，若到本國至宮城門不得便入，但立門外請報於王，或問何名稱釋迦苾芻，王或呼召乃可前進。
translation: Now, you may go. If you arrive at the palace gate and aren't allowed to enter, just stand outside the gate and ask the king what you call the Śākyamuni, or the king may summon you before you can enter.

source_sentence: 又若問言：『汝實是釋迦苾芻否？』
translation: Suppose he also asks, 'Are you really Śākyamuni?'

source_sentence: 即答：『是實。』
translation: That's the answer, 'It's true.'

source_sentence: 若問：『一切義成亦如是像耶？』
translation: If he asks, 'Are all the meanings formed like this?'

source_sentence: 答言：『亦爾。』
translation: He replied, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 又問：『一切義成來否？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'Have all the meanings come true?'
He said, 'Come.'

source_sentence: 『當在何時？』
translation: 'When will it be?'

source_sentence: 便言：『後當七日。』
translation: He then said, 'It will be seven days later.'

source_sentence: 言訖便出；若留者亦不得住。
translation: After he said that, he left, but if he stayed, he wouldn't be allowed to stay.

source_sentence: 王曰：『一切義成若來，住宮內否？』
translation: The king said, 'Would you stay in the palace if you were to come, given all the meanings?'

source_sentence: 答言：『不住。』
translation: He replied, 'I don't live there.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『樂住何處？』
translation: The king said, 'Where do you happily abide?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『林野或住精舍。』
translation: He answered, 'A monk's dwelling in a forest or in a monk's dormitory.'

source_sentence: 若問：『何名精舍？』
translation: If he asks, 'What's the name of a fine dwelling?'

source_sentence: 便可如祇樹給孤精舍具以聞奏。」
translation: You can then take the Gṛdhrakūṭa monastery and fully hear about it."

source_sentence: 佛教示已，烏那曳曩欲行。
translation: After the Buddha instructed him, Ānāthapiṇḍada wanted to go.

source_sentence: 佛又告言：「王者一言便成富貴，天起心念一切皆得，一切聖人亦復如是。」
translation: The Buddha also told him, "With one word, a king becomes wealthy and powerful, and everything that arises in the mind of a god becomes available, so do all the sages."

source_sentence: 佛借神力，烏那曳曩於剎那頃到迦毘羅城，如佛所教心住正念，到宮城門住立不進。
translation: With the Buddha's supernatural power, Upaniṣad went to the city of Kapilavastu in a flash and stayed there with his mind correctly mindful as the Buddha had taught him, standing at the palace gate and not advancing.

source_sentence: 謂閽吏曰：「汝可奏聞，有釋迦苾芻詣門不進。」
translation: He told the procurator, "You may report that there's a Śākyamuni who approaches the gate and doesn't enter."

source_sentence: 王令：「呼入。」
translation: The king ordered, "Summon them to enter."

source_sentence: 時烏那曳曩蒙召即入。
translation: Udayinna then was summoned and entered.

source_sentence: 淨飯纔見，怪而問曰：「烏那曳曩汝出家耶？」
translation: When Jīvaka saw him, he was surprised and asked, "Have you left home, Udayinī?"

source_sentence: 答言：「出家。」
translation: He replied, "Leave home."

source_sentence: 王言：「汝當去時何言奏我？」
translation: The king said, "When you leave, what will you say to me?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「奉命即爾，本不出家，世尊威神方便開化，佛世難值正法難聞，皇子尚捨至尊，小臣何可固執？」
translation: He replied, "I was instructed to do so; I had never left home; the Bhagavān's authoritative power and skillful means enlightened me; the Buddha's world is hard to come by, and the true teaching is hard to hear; the prince has yet to abandon his supreme position; how can a junior minister be stubborn?"

source_sentence: 王言似責心實不瞋，又以儀相非常，不以舊臣見待，即命上殿執手慰勞，乃令近臣敷座盥淨，奉上湯藥及果實等。
translation: He ordered him to go up to the palace, take his hand and console him, and then he had his ministers prepare his seat, wash up, and serve him medicine and fruit.

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩威儀非凡舉止有則，言必詳審情極和暢，王以初覩烏那曳曩剃髮易袈，言論久之全忘問佛。
translation: Because he had first seen him shave his hair and change his robes, the king had forgotten to ask about the Buddha after speaking for a long time.

source_sentence: 及至於此而復問言：「我子一切義成，善相威儀亦如此耶？」
translation: When he arrived, he asked again, "My son, have you accomplished everything, and are your good looks and manner thus?"

source_sentence: 答言：「以我喻佛，由將芥子等須彌山，又如牛跡比於大海，乃至窻牖之明同彼日光。」
translation: He replied, "I'm a metaphor for the Buddha, for I am like Mt. Sumeru, which is the size of a mustard seed, or like the trail of an ox compared to the ocean, or even the light from a window that's the same as sunlight."

source_sentence: 王聞是語思念於子，不覺悶絕仆於地上，近臣以水灑面方穌。
translation: When the king heard those words, he thought about his son and fell to the ground, overcome by sorrow, as his ministers sprinkled his face with water.

source_sentence: 良久復問：「我子來耶？」
translation: After a long time, he asked, "Is my son here?"
He answered, "Come."

source_sentence: 又曰：「何時到來？」
translation: Again, he said, "When will he come?"

source_sentence: 「後當七日。」
translation: "It will be seven days afterward."

source_sentence: 王即下勅潔淨內宮，嚴飾殿宇，以備世尊及聖眾至。
translation: The king then ordered that the inner palace be cleansed and the buildings decorated to prepare for the arrival of the Bhagavān and his noble people.

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩白大王言：「世尊若來，不住宮內。」
translation: Udayinna said to the king, "If the Bhagavān were to come, he wouldn't stay inside the palace."

source_sentence: 王曰：「樂住何處？」
translation: The king said, "Where would he be happy to stay?"

source_sentence: 「若非林野即住精舍。」
translation: "If it's not a forest, it's a monastery."

source_sentence: 王曰：「何名精舍？」
translation: The king said, "What's the name of a monastery?"

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩即以精舍次第白於王曰：「十六殿堂、六十小堂，世尊居中聖眾四布，諸受用具悉使備足。」
translation: Udayinna then presented the king with the order of the monastery, saying, "There are 16 halls and 60 chapels in which the Bhagavān lives, in which the noble people are arranged in four ways, and in which all the proper implements are made available."

source_sentence: 王聞說已，遣使速往儞也(二合)誐嚕駄林，刻日併工，如給孤精舍次第建立，倍持珍寶而嚴飾之。
translation: After hearing what he said, the king sent an envoy quickly to the grove of Nyiye (bhog) Gaṅgārā, worked for a few days to build the monastery in order as it had been given to Gokul, and adorned it with an abundance of treasures.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊至時遣大目犍連：「汝可遍告諸苾芻眾，我今欲往迦毘羅城，宜各受持袈裟應器，或可為見父母宗親而行化利。」
translation: The Bhagavān then sent a message to Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Tell all the monks and nuns that I want to go to Kapilavastu, so they can each accept a monk's robe and a container, or they can meet their parents and relatives for the benefit of the teaching."

source_sentence: 大目犍連奉佛教勅，具以佛言遍告一切阿羅漢等已。
translation: After he had received the Buddha's order, Mahāmaudgalyāyana told all the arhats and others exactly what the Buddha had said.

source_sentence: 佛領大眾出給孤精舍，往赴迦毘羅城父王之請，諸阿羅漢前後圍繞。
translation: The Buddha led the whole group out of the monastery and went to the request of his father in Kapilavastu, surrounded by arhats.

source_sentence: 佛即瞻顧謂阿羅漢等曰：「我此眷屬是調伏、是離欲、是善解脫、是阿羅漢、是佛眷屬，譬如牛王處於眾群，亦如象王眾象圍繞，師子王師子圍繞，鵝王眾鵝圍繞，金翅王金翅圍繞；又如眾學隨師，眾病求醫，眾兵輔將，眾商依主；又如轉輪聖王千子圍繞，持國天王樂神圍繞，增長天王鳩盤茶鬼圍繞，廣目天王龍眾圍繞，多聞天王夜叉圍繞；日天千光圍繞，月天眾星圍繞，帝釋天眾圍繞，梵王梵眾圍繞；乃至復如悉帝彌魚處於海中，亦如海神攝聚眾水。
translation: 佛即瞻顧謂阿羅漢等曰：「我此眷屬是調伏、是離欲、是善解脫、是阿羅漢、是佛眷屬，譬如牛王處於眾群，亦如象王眾象圍繞，師子王師子圍繞，鵝王眾鵝圍繞，金翅王金翅圍繞；又如眾學隨師，眾病求醫，眾兵輔將，眾商依主；又如轉輪聖王千子圍繞，持國天王樂神圍繞，增長天王鳩盤茶鬼圍繞，廣目天王龍眾圍繞，多聞天王夜叉圍繞；日天千光圍繞，月天眾星圍繞，帝釋天眾圍繞，梵王梵眾圍繞；乃至復如悉帝彌魚處於海中，亦如海神攝聚眾水。

source_sentence: 如來之身，三十二相、八十種好具足圓滿，光明莊嚴，如千日光照耀一切，行步巍巍猶如寶山，具足大悲、十力、四無所畏等一切諸法。」
translation: The Tathāgata's body is replete with the full gamut of the thirty-two marks and eighty attributes, adorned with radiance like a thousand suns shining above all, majestic in its walk like a mountain of treasure, and fully endowed with all the teachings, including great compassion, the ten powers, and the four forms of fearlessness."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊與是眷屬隨路而去，次第遊化，至迦毘羅城不遠有嚕賀迦河。
translation: The Bhagavān then departed with his retinue and wandered from place to place, reaching the Ruohāga River not far from Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王將諸眷屬及大小臣同在河邊，預嚴寶蓋幢幡，擊鈸吹貝廣設妓樂，焚香散花顒望世尊；又復自嚕賀迦河，至儞也(二合)誐嚕馱林，乃至城中及與郭外，王勅士庶預令嚴潔，丘墟沙礫悉使除去，布以淨土灑以香水，量其遠近各置香爐，俟佛經過焚香供養。
translation: The king of Jīvaka then gathered his retinue and ministers at the river's edge, decorated jeweled canopies, banners, struck cymbals, blew shells, arranged musicians, and burned incense and scattered flowers to pay homage to the Bhagavān; he also went from the Ruohāga River to the grove of Nīyāga and beyond, where he commanded the people to make it clean, removed all the sand and debris from the hills, spread pure soil, sprinkled perfume, and placed incense burners near and far to burn incense and make offerings to the Buddha when he passed by.

source_sentence: 時迦毘羅城士庶長者若男若女，各各執持殊妙香花，立於路次供養世尊。
translation: It was then that some of the elders of Kapilavastu, both men and women, each carried a wonderful scented flower and stood in the path in order to make offerings to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 是彼人眾咸謂：「世尊昔為太子今得成佛。」
translation: That crowd of people all said, "The Bhagavān was once a prince, and now he's become a buddha."

source_sentence: 歡喜踊躍欲觀儀範。
translation: They were elated and eager to observe the deportment.

source_sentence: 又有起念：「父子相見其禮云何？
translation: Another thought arose, "What do fathers and sons say when they meet?

source_sentence: 若子拜父與世無殊，若父拜子國禮未可。
translation: If a son worships his father, there's no difference between the world and him; if a father worships his son, it's not possible to pay homage to the state.

source_sentence: 太子修道苦行成佛，必應與世有別異也。」
translation: If the prince cultivated asceticism and became a buddha, he would surely be different from the world."

source_sentence: 人眾填噎路無間隙。
translation: The crowd filled the choked road without a gap.

source_sentence: 佛與聖眾將至河次，知王眷屬悉在彼處，乃自思惟：「今迦毘羅城父王眷屬及人民等，各各念言：『太子去時百千天人前後圍繞，乘空而去雪山修行。』
translation: As the Buddha and the noble crowd were about to reach the river, they knew that the king's retinue was there, so they thought to themselves, "Now, the father's retinue and the people of Kapilavastu are each thinking, 'When the prince left, he was surrounded by a hundred thousand gods and men who rode off in the sky to cultivate his practice on Mount Snow.'

source_sentence: 又云：『已成正覺領眾化導，今徒步歸國有何奇特？』
translation: They also said, 'What's so special about having become a fully enlightened leader who guides people and returns to his country on foot now?'

source_sentence: 我今宜應現其神足令父王見，及使人民歎異歡喜。」
translation: Now, I should demonstrate my spiritual powers for my father to see and for the people to admire and rejoice over."

source_sentence: 王及眷屬目見大眾，方欲奔趨迎接世尊，佛於是時入三摩地，出於東方虛空之中，現行、立、坐、臥四威儀相，或身上出水身下出火，身上出火身下出水，復於身中放大光明，或青、或黃、或赤、或白，及與紅等間雜諸色，猶如玻[王*梨]互相映徹，乃至南、西、北方亦復如是。
translation: When the king and his retinue saw the multitude and were about to run to meet the Bhagavān, the Buddha entered samādhi and emerged into the eastern sky with the four postures of sitting, standing, sitting, and lying down, with water coming out of his body, fire coming out of his body, and water coming out of his body with fire coming out of his body.

source_sentence: 又諸苾芻各各現通，踊身上昇高七多羅樹，世尊於中亦現一身，諸苾芻眾現通不等，或六多羅樹、或五、或四、或三、二、一，佛恒高出與眾有異。
translation: The Bhagavān also appears as one of the many Bhikṣus who each show supernormal powers and rise up high above the seven palm trees, while the Bhagavān shows one of them, and the Bhagavān shows supernormal powers that vary from six palm trees, five, four, three, two, or one, with the Buddha constantly rising above them.

source_sentence: 如是現已，佛與聖眾忽然隱沒，如彈指頃已在本處。
translation: After such an appearance, the Buddha and the noble assembly suddenly disappeared and were at their original location in a snap of the fingers.

source_sentence: 王及眷屬倍生信仰，既前迎接。
translation: The king and his retinue had renewed faith and went forward to greet them.

source_sentence: 王見大眾皆被袈裟儀相相似，初不辯認誰是世尊、孰為弟子。
translation: When the king saw that the whole crowd was similarly robed and mannered, he didn't recognize who was the Bhagavān or who was his disciple.

source_sentence: 時烏那曳曩引淨飯王至世尊前，王見世尊尚存子想。
translation: Udayinna led King Jaladhara to the Bhagavān, and the king saw that the Bhagavān still had thoughts of being a son.

source_sentence: 烏那曳曩乃謂王曰：「如來斷煩惱習心得自在，如日照世住於虛空，乘真如乘證最上覺圓滿十力，具一切智，相好光明清淨照物，於法自在利益無邊。
translation: Then, Udayinna told the king, "The Tathāgata has mastery over afflictive habits and mind, abides in space like the sun shining in the world, rides the vehicle of true reality, realizes supreme awakening, perfects the ten powers, possesses omniscience, has radiant and clear features, and illuminates things, and has unlimited power over the Dharma to benefit him.

source_sentence: 請王歸仰，當求聖道。」
translation: I beg the king to revere him and ask him to pursue the noble path."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，惺悟諦信，五體投地禮佛雙足，說伽陀曰：「生時大地皆振動，　　樹影覆身不隨日；　復以普眼觀眾生，　　是故我禮最尊足。」
translation: After hearing these words, King Jōtoku awakened to true faith, threw his five bodies to the ground and bowed his feet to the Buddha, saying, "When I was born, the whole earth was shaken, and the shadows of trees covered my body, not following the sun; and with my universal vision, I was able to see birth; therefore, I bowed my head to the most honored feet."

source_sentence: 時諸釋眾見淨飯王禮佛足已。
translation: When the crowd of Śākyamuni saw King Jīvaka bowing his head to the Buddha's feet, some of them said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 即有言曰：「世尊云何背於世法化眾生也？」
translation: Some of them then said, "Bhagavān, how do you deviate from the teachings of the world to teach sentient beings?"

source_sentence: 王聞眾議，告而言曰：「汝豈不聞？
translation: When the king heard the council, he told them, "Don't you hear it?

source_sentence: 悉達生時大地咸皆六種振動，一切世間光明普照，所有黑闇日不到處，諸威德光亦所不及，是時光明皆悉照耀，彼黑闇處所有眾生，皆以惡業而墮於中，忽因光照互得相見，各各有言：『此中何時更生眾生？』
translation: When Siddhârtha is born, the whole earth is shaken in six ways, and the light of the whole world shines universally, so that where there's darkness that the sun doesn't reach, the light of the mighty virtues doesn't reach them either, and then the light shines everywhere, and all the sentient beings in that dark place, who have fallen there because of bad karma, suddenly see each other because of the light, and each says, 'When will sentient beings be reborn here?'

source_sentence: 於此之時，我已頂禮最尊之足。
translation: At the time, I bowed my head at the feet of the most honored one.

source_sentence: 是悉達多未出家時，行詣贍部樹下而坐，清淨無欲離不善法，已斷一切分別疑惑，樂住無詣寂靜之定，一切林樹影隨日轉，贍部樹影廕身不移。
translation: When Siddhârtha, who had yet to leave home, was walking up to sit under the Jambū tree, he was pure and without desire, free of unskillful things, had ended all discriminating doubts, and was happily abiding in the tranquil concentration of attaining nowhere, the shadow of all the trees in the forest followed the sun, and the shadow of the Jambū tree covered his body and didn't move.

source_sentence: 我既得見驚怪非常，乃於此時又禮尊足。
translation: I was so surprised to see that that I paid homage to the venerable's feet again at this point.

source_sentence: 我今所禮，方在第三。」
translation: Now, this is the third place I've worshipped."

source_sentence: 佛說眾許摩訶帝經卷第十二
translation: Foshuo zhongshi mahātei jing roll twelfth
